results.title: I'm dependent, you're addicted
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Takes a look at the medical facts about the five main groups of abused drugs, examining some of the popular misconceptions about drug dependence. Shows how the illegal drug problem grows out of legal drug abuse. Uses laboratory animals to show effects. Touches upon unpublished American research into cannabis.

results.title: How safe is surgery?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Surgeons today perform operations which would have seemed miraculous only a few years ago; but even now, a century after Joseph Lister published the first accounts of his revolutionary technique of antiseptic surgery, infection after operations is a menace, probably costing the Health Service six million pounds a year. Investigates both the techniques used to prevent infection during an actual operation and research into the causes of infection which still trouble British hospitals. Reporter: Christopher Chataway.

results.title: How do you read?
results.creator_credit: Harris Watts, Stephen Rose and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Being unable to read is a personal disaster. Learning to read at an early age is very important. This film demonstrates various modern techniques and devices used to increase reading speed, and it shows that the speed of reading and the rate of comprehension are related to the material being studied.

results.title: How do you read? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Harris Watts, Stephen Rose and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Being unable to read is a personal disaster. Learning to read at an early age is very important. This film demonstrates various modern techniques and devices used to increase reading speed, and it shows that the speed of reading and the rate of comprehension are related to the material being studied.

results.title: The Hot-blooded dinosaurs
results.creator_credit: Robin Bates, Robin Brightwell, BBC-TV and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Challenges our conventional ideas of dinosaurs. Argues that they were not slow-moving, cold blooded reptiles, but were agile, intelligent and hot-blooded. Points out that they didn’t all die out and that their descendants are alive and well and living all around us.

results.title: Hello Universe
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Most scientists are convinced that extra-terrestrial life does exist, estimating that the galaxy is swarming with life. But the hard evidence is disappointingly scarce and as the search program gathers pace a different viewpoint is emerging - that after all the human race is alone in the universe. This program explores the probabilities of galactic neighbours.

results.title: The Greenhouse effect (BBC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Burning fossil fuels such as coal, oil and gas adds more carbon dioxide to the atmosphere. This colourless, odourless, naturally occurring gas turns the atmosphere into a giant greenhouse, trapping more of the sun’s heat and raising the temperature each year. This informative documentary looks at the causes behind the greenhouse effect and the resulting possible changes in the earth’s environment.

Coverage of the life of a green plant. The work involved in the plant producing its own food is discussed as it the importance of this process to an overall understanding of ecology. Implications for the future with respect to harvesting energy and food with this process are also raised.

results.title: Goodbye Gutenberg
results.creator_credit: Edward Goldwyn, BBC and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Printed work is our main method of storing, retrieving and transmitting information, but the tiny electronic pulses in computers today are about to change that. Electronic text means words being stored, displayed, restored or sent around the world. The changes this could cause are discussed. Presented by Anthony Smith.

results.title: Ghost of the Amoco Cadiz
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
In 40 years three major maritime casualties have changed the way ships are worked. The ghost of the biggest accident, the Amoco Cadiz, haunts the shipping industry, and a great deal of research work has been stimulated by the events of that fateful day.
